panels.description:
# Job runs overview

## What does it mean
This metric shows the number of active and failed job runs in Metronome over time.

## Expected behavior
Number of failed jobs should be zero at all times. In terms of active runs, the shape of the graph strongly depends on what schedule your jobs run on so it will differ in various clusters.

## Where to look when for further information:
The next metrics can provide additional information:

 * `metronome_jobs_started`
panels.title: Active/failed job runs

panels.description:
# Staged job runs

### What does it mean
Number of staged job runs is count of jobs that we already requested to start in mesos but they did not turn running yet.

### Expected behavior
Number of staged jobs should be roughly equal to number of job runs started in that time period. If this value is growing or have high value it might indicate a problem with an agent (docker daemon hangs, image can't be pulled, etc.).

### Where to look when for further information
The next metrics can provide additional information:

 * `metronome_mesos_task_updates_task_error`
 * `metronome_mesos_task_updates_task_error_counter`
panels.title: Staged job runs

panels.description:
# Launch overdue job runs

### What does it mean
Overdue jobs are those that we already accepted offer for but they haven’t become running within the `METRONOME_SCHEDULER_TASK_LAUNCH_TIMEOUT` or `METRONOME_SCHEDULER_TASK_LAUNCH_CONFIRM_TIMEOUT` respectively.

### Expected behavior
Value of this should be 0 at all times. 

### Where to look when for further information
The next metrics can provide additional information:

 * `metronome_mesos_task_updates_task_error`
 * `metronome_mesos_task_updates_task_error_counter`
panels.title: Launch overdue job runs

panels.description:
# Leardship duration of master nodes

### What does it mean
It shows which master node is a leader and how long is the leadership period.

### Expected behavior
This value should be linearly increasing over time. If a leader is being re-elected frequently (short leadership duration) that can be a sign of instability. Node can lose leadership e.g. because of lost connection to zookeeper, mesos or because of some other unrecoverable error.
panels.title: Uptime and leader duration

panels.description:
# Mesos offers metrics

### Declined offers
Offers that were declined by Marathon. If that value is high than 

### Incoming offers
Offers that marathon received from Mesos. If this value is low, then Marathon is starving unless a `supress` call was issued.
panels.title: Mesos offers overview

panels.description:
# Mesos offers metrics

### Used offers
This metric shows the number of used Mesos offers. If Metronome is trying to deploy a service and receives enough incoming offers but doesn't seem to use any, then this usually means that the offers aren't a fit (bad role, not enough cpu/mem other resources, etc.)
panels.title: Used mesos offers

panels.description: This metric shows 95 percentile response latency. High numbers mean that marathon is experiencing quite some load.
panels.title: HTTP request duration p95

panels.description: These metrics show the size of Marathon requests. Too high values can lead to Marathon being overloaded with data serialization.
panels.title: HTTP request size rate

panels.description: These metrics show the size of Marathon responses. Too high values can lead to Marathon being overloaded with data serialization.
panels.title: HTTP response size rate

panels.description: This metric shows the rate of requests with resulted in status 200-299.
panels.title: HTTP response 2xx rates

panels.description: This metric shows the rate of requests with resulted in status 500-599. A small amount of such responses are expected in some situations, such as leader re-election.
panels.title: HTTP response 5xx error rates

panels.description: An overall growing pattern where more and more heap is being used can be an indication of a problem.
panels.title: Heap usage

panels.description: A sudden change in number of threads can be an indication of a problem. Also having too many threads may be an indication of possible performance issues.
panels.title: Active and runnable threads count

panels.description: An overall growing pattern where more and more memory is being used can be an indication of a problem.
panels.title: Total memory usage

panels.description: A sudden change in number of threads can be an indication of a problem.
panels.title: Marathon waiting and timed waiting threads count
